intro: Potentilla palustris f. typica, commonly known as the marsh cinquefoil, is a low-growing perennial shrub native to wetland habitats in North America. It features small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer, typically from June to July. The plant has finely divided, grass-like leaves and thrives in moist, acidic soils. It is often found in bogs, marshes, and along the edges of lakes and streams. Due to its ecological importance, it plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various insects and small animals.
